bibl.title: John Matthews v. Henry M. White. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
To the Honorable JEREMIAH NETERER, Judge of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.

Now comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration for the District of Washington, appearing by T.W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, and produces the body of JOHN MATTHEWS in obedience to the command and direction of the writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled matter, being the person named in the petition for said writ.

For answer and return to said writ, respondent avers that he detained in his custody the body of JOHN MATTHEWS for deportation from the United States under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Labor issued to him, the said respondent.

Respondent attaches herto the records, decisions and exhibits, both on the hearing before him as Commissioner of Immigration and the hearing in appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, he prays that said writ may be discharged.
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON } ss. NORTHERN DIVISION.

T.W. Lynch, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says: That he is Acting Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return and knows the contents thereof and that he believes the same to be true.
T.W. Lynch Subscribed and sworn to before me this ___ day of September, 1921
F.M. Harshberger Clerk, U.S. Dist Court, Western Dist. of Washington
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF JOHN MATTHEWS FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington Northen Division
F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By S.E. Leitch Deputy
